docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 26 -- The Presidential elections in Paraguay that had been scheduled for Feb. 15 have been indefinitely postponed, it was learned today from a private source in Asuncion. Eduardo Loizaga Caballero, counselor of the Paraguyan...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 26 -- The Presidential elections in Paraguay that had been scheduled for Feb. 15 have been indefinitely postponed, it was learned today from a private source in Asuncion. Eduardo Loizaga Caballero, counselor of the Paraguyan Embassy here, said he had no information on the subject.
docs.abstract: Pres elections reptd postponed; civil strife noted

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Walker Lowry's article, "Communism to the South of Us," is interesting but, in some respects, untrue. No doubt his recent experiences in Ecuador and Central America colored his report. I, who lived only in Argentina, Uruguay and Cuba, cannot place...
docs.lead_paragraph: Walker Lowry's article, "Communism to the South of Us," is interesting but, in some respects, untrue. No doubt his recent experiences in Ecuador and Central America colored his report. I, who lived only in Argentina, Uruguay and Cuba, cannot place these nations against the terrifying background of poverty, ignorance and backwardness he describes.

docs.snippet: THE Passport Division of the State Department issued 202,424 passports during 1947, the second largest number issued and renewed in the history of the division, which goes back to 1914. According to the report of Mrs. Ruth B. Shipley, director of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE Passport Division of the State Department issued 202,424 passports during 1947, the second largest number issued and renewed in the history of the division, which goes back to 1914. According to the report of Mrs. Ruth B. Shipley, director of the Passport Division, 1930 was the peak year for that office, with 203,174 passports issued and renewed.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 31 -- The statement made at a recent New York Exporters Association luncheon to the effect that "Uruguay is fast becoming a slow payer, delaying payments four to six months" caused considerable feeling in business circles...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 31 -- The statement made at a recent New York Exporters Association luncheon to the effect that "Uruguay is fast becoming a slow payer, delaying payments four to six months" caused considerable feeling in business circles here.
docs.abstract: US exporters 'slow pay' charge resented in business circles; Min Arroyo Torres officially refutes charge

headline.main: URUGUAY RESENTS 'SLOW PAY' LABEL; Statement Unwarranted, Says Finance Minister, Under New License System

docs.snippet: A STUDY by the Eno Foundation for highway traffic control shows that the average posted speed limit is generally ignored by the motorist even at the risk of arrest. This flouting of legal edicts is ascribed to speed limits that are too low or to the...
docs.lead_paragraph: A STUDY by the Eno Foundation for highway traffic control shows that the average posted speed limit is generally ignored by the motorist even at the risk of arrest. This flouting of legal edicts is ascribed to speed limits that are too low or to the inability of most drivers to determine safe and reasonable rates.
docs.abstract: L Williams and C M Upham Jr offer to advise cities lacking experts

headline.main: AUTOMOBILES: SPEEDING; Study Shows Limits That Are Too Low Invite Motorists to Break the Law

docs.snippet: Confusion struck the foreign exchange market at the outset of trading last Monday when it faced the news of the devaluation of the French franc announced from Paris on the preceding day (Sunday).

docs.snippet: OFFICIAL inauguration last Sunday of a new political state called the "Federation of Malay" is expected to have philatelic repercussions. Units within the Federation are Johore, Kedah, Kelantan, Negri Sembilan, Pahang, Perak, Selangor, Trengganu,...
docs.lead_paragraph: OFFICIAL inauguration last Sunday of a new political state called the "Federation of Malay" is expected to have philatelic repercussions. Units within the Federation are Johore, Kedah, Kelantan, Negri Sembilan, Pahang, Perak, Selangor, Trengganu, each of which at times has had its own stamps, and .. erlis, which has never had individual postal paper.
